Hannongbua would like to thank the Ratchadaphisek Somphot Endowment Fund (2015), Chulalongkorn University ( CU-58-033-AM ). Vo Thuy Phuong would like to thank the CU. graduate school thesis grant. S. Fritzsche would like to thank the Kanchanapisek Fund, Chulalongkorn University. head.citation-title: Methane in zeolitic imidazolate framework ZIF-90: Adsorption and diffusion by molecular dynamics and Gibbs ensemble Monte Carlo
head.abstracts: © 2016There is experimental evidence from adsorption and permeation studies that methane can enter the Zeolitic Imidazolate Framework (ZIF)-90 framework despite the fact that the critical diameter of methane (3.8 Å) is larger than the window size of ZIF-90 (3.5 Å) assuming a rigid framework. Therefore, adsorption and diffusion of methane in the ZIF-90 were investigated by Molecular Dynamics (MD) and Gibbs Ensemble Monte Carlo. Various interaction force fields have been tested and a suitable one has been proposed. Results of structural and dynamical properties of methane in ZIF-90 are presented. Like for methane in ZIF-8, no gate opening was found in this paper for methane in ZIF-90 up to a pressure of 260 bar. Therefore, the adsorption and diffusion of methane in ZIF-90 can be explained by a flexible framework.

coredata.dc:description: There is experimental evidence from adsorption and permeation studies that methane can enter the Zeolitic Imidazolate Framework (ZIF)-90 framework despite the fact that the critical diameter of methane (3.8 Å) is larger than the window size of ZIF-90 (3.5 Å) assuming a rigid framework. Various interaction force fields have been tested and a suitable one has been proposed. Results of structural and dynamical properties of methane in ZIF-90 are presented. Like for methane in ZIF-8, no gate opening was found in this paper for methane in ZIF-90 up to a pressure of 260 bar. Therefore, the adsorption and diffusion of methane in ZIF-90 can be explained by a flexible framework.
